description.narrative:
In reference to a recent study by NAGAAD peace building in El Afwein district (Sanaag region), and other 6 villages under its administration, it was found that there were large number of conflict-orphaned children, who lost their parents during period ofthe inter-clan fighting, living in scattered areas throughout the district without proper care and education. Research also noted that un-educated, unemployed youth who had no access to any opportunities were a contributing factor to the conflicts in Sanaag region. Youth who lost a close relative to the conflict are more prone to participate in new rounds of conflicts for revenge. To our knowledge, there have not been any proper studies on these underlying conflict-contributing dynamics in Sanaag region.
To address these two conflicts contributing factors, it became necessary for Nagaad Network to do study on inter-clan conflict/war impact on war orphaned children and youth to deeply understand their livelihood conditions and priority needs in regardto their education, employment, and specific to youth’s contribution in inter-clan conflicts particularly in retaliations and revenges that can cause large scale conflicts. The study will use to inform in designing our current and future programming to address those underlying causes and promote peace and security of the conflict affected areas (Sanaag region); improve livelihoods and skills development for war vulnerable children and youth; and enhance integration of conflict affected community.

participating-org.narrative: Nagaad is the women#s network in Somaliland, which ON has been supporting since its establishment in1997. Nagaad was formed by 32 women#s groups in Hargeisa. While it has raised its profile tremendously after 2000, with a range of advocacy and publicity actions in the media, notably around women#s political participation, it has always remained a of 32 member organisations, many of them remain weak, except for a few larger ones (some of whom are also counterparts of Oxfam Novib). Nagaad built its own office and received support from a variety of donors. Over the last four years Nagaad has elaborated a restructuring plan and a new strategic plan that involves: (a) more focus on networking instead of direct implementation; (b) admission of 15 new members from the regions of Somaliland, and working relationships with regional women#s umbrellas and professional associations. The network now has a membership of 46organisations.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation

description.narrative: CSOs representing excluded and marginalised individuals have strengthened capacity and maintain and expand their civic space.
CSOs with improved organizational and technical capacity to act and to maintain and expand civic space
CSOs with improved organizational and technical capacity to act in favour of equality and equity
